pirate.translation[0].definitions[0].def: someone who sails on the seas, attacking other boats and stealing things from them
pirate.translation[0].definitions[1].def: someone who dishonestly copies and sells another person’s work
pirate.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Computer game pirates cost the industry twenty million pounds a year.
pirate.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to illegally copy and sell another person’s work such as a book, DVD, or computer program
pirate.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: pirated copies of the best-selling computer games
pirate.translation[2].definitions[0].def: a person or organization that dishonestly copies and sells films, tapes etc for which the COPYRIGHT (=legal ownership) belongs to others
pirate.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: Manufacturers fear that the city may emerge as a new centre for the software pirates.
pirate.translation[2].definitions[1].def: illegal radio or television broadcasts, or the station sending them out
pirate.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: About 80 pirate cable systems have brought US network news into thousands of homes.
pirate.translation[2].definitions[2].def: a person who steals from a ship at sea
